snippet: Bradley Manning, 25, who provided WikiLeaks with more than 700,000 files, will be eligible for parole in about seven years.
abstract: Pfc Bradley Manning is sentenced to 35 years in prison for providing more than 700,000 government files to WikiLeaks; sentence is longest ever handed down in case involving leak of United States government information for purpose of having information reported to public; leak lifted veil on American and military diplomatic activities worldwide; Manning will be eligible for parole in about seven years.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and EMMARIE HUETTEMAN

lead_paragraph: Bradley Manning, 25, who provided WikiLeaks with more than 700,000 files, will be eligible for parole in about seven years.

headline.main: Manning Sentenced to 35 Years for a Pivotal Leak of U.S. Files
headline.print_headline: Manning Sentenced to 35 Years For a Pivotal Leak of U.S. Files

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
